SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. If you rather have someone else do the writing at your dictation, this is quite acceptable.

1. Your full name: EDWARD HENRY WILHELM

2. Your address: BRITISH COLUMBIA, S.S.S.I.

3. Date: APRIL 14, 1952

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): EXETER, ONTARIO

5. What was your father's name and occupation? WILLIAM JAMES WHITE, NEWSPAPER MAN, FAVOURITE BRANDON, U.S.A.

6. When did you come to Saskatoon? SUN, MAY 1872 - LATER SUPT. CAMBELL, IMMIGRATION OFFICE

7. How old were you when you first came to Saskatoon? (Give month and year): FEBRUARY 1903

8. What were your reasons for coming West? WANTED TO REUNITE WITH MY MOTHER AND FAMILY

9. How did you learn about the West? THROUGH OTHER PEOPLE'S LETTERS ABOUT IT?

10. How did you get here? BY TRAIN FROM PRINCE ALBERT TO SASKATOON VIA PRINCE ALBERT VIA NEWSPAPER
